member.summary: iCUE-SDK: dummy value

member.summary: iCUE-SDK: array of CorsairDevicePropertyId members supported by device

member.name: F:RGB.NET.Devices.Corsair.CorsairDevicePropertyId.MicEnabled
member.summary: iCUE-SDK: indicates Mic state (On or Off); used for headset, headset stand

member.name: F:RGB.NET.Devices.Corsair.CorsairDevicePropertyId.SurroundSoundEnabled
member.summary: iCUE-SDK: indicates Surround Sound state (On or Off); used for headset, headset stand

member.name: F:RGB.NET.Devices.Corsair.CorsairDevicePropertyId.SidetoneEnabled
member.summary: iCUE-SDK: indicates Sidetone state (On or Off); used for headset (where applicable)

member.name: F:RGB.NET.Devices.Corsair.CorsairDevicePropertyId.EqualizerPreset
member.summary: iCUE-SDK: the number of active equalizer preset (integer, 1 - 5); used for headset, headset stand

member.name: F:RGB.NET.Devices.Corsair.CorsairDevicePropertyId.PhysicalLayout
member.summary: iCUE-SDK: keyboard physical layout (see CorsairPhysicalLayout for valid values); used for keyboard

member.name: F:RGB.NET.Devices.Corsair.CorsairDevicePropertyId.LogicalLayout
member.summary: iCUE-SDK: keyboard logical layout (see CorsairLogicalLayout for valid values); used for keyboard

member.name: F:RGB.NET.Devices.Corsair.CorsairDevicePropertyId.MacroKeyArray
member.summary: iCUE-SDK: array of programmable G, M or S keys on device

member.name: F:RGB.NET.Devices.Corsair.CorsairDevicePropertyId.BatteryLevel
member.summary: iCUE-SDK: battery level (0 - 100); used for wireless devices

member.name: F:RGB.NET.Devices.Corsair.CorsairDevicePropertyId.ChannelLedCount
member.summary: iCUE-SDK: total number of LEDs connected to the channel

member.summary: iCUE-SDK: number of LED-devices (fans, strips, etc.) connected to the channel which is controlled by the DIY device

member.summary: iCUE-SDK: array of integers, each element describes the number of LEDs controlled by the channel device

member.name: F:RGB.NET.Devices.Corsair.CorsairDevicePropertyId.ChannelDeviceTypeArray
member.summary: iCUE-SDK: array of CorsairChannelDeviceType members, each element describes the type of the channel device

member.name: T:RGB.NET.Devices.Corsair.CorsairError
member.summary: iCUE-SDK: Shared list of all errors which could happen during calling of Corsair* functions.

member.name: F:RGB.NET.Devices.Corsair.CorsairError.Success
member.summary: iCUE-SDK: if previously called function completed successfully

member.name: F:RGB.NET.Devices.Corsair.CorsairError.NotConnected
member.summary: iCUE-SDK: if iCUE is not running or was shut down or third-party control is disabled in iCUE settings (runtime error), or if developer did not call CorsairConnect after calling CorsairDisconnect or on app start (developer error)

member.name: F:RGB.NET.Devices.Corsair.CorsairError.NoControl
member.summary: iCUE-SDK: if some other client has or took over exclusive control (runtime error)

member.name: F:RGB.NET.Devices.Corsair.CorsairError.IncompatibleProtocol
member.summary: iCUE-SDK: if developer is calling the function that is not supported by the server (either because protocol has broken by server or client or because the function is new and server is too old. Check CorsairSessionDetails for details) (developer error)

member.name: F:RGB.NET.Devices.Corsair.CorsairError.InvalidArguments
member.summary: iCUE-SDK: if developer supplied invalid arguments to the function (for specifics look at function descriptions) (developer error)

member.name: F:RGB.NET.Devices.Corsair.CorsairError.InvalidOperation
member.summary: iCUE-SDK: if developer is calling the function that is not allowed due to current state (reading improper properties from device, or setting callback when it has already been set) (developer error)

member.name: F:RGB.NET.Devices.Corsair.CorsairError.DeviceNotFound
member.summary: iCUE-SDK: if invalid device id has been supplied as an argument to the function (when device id refers to disconnected device) (runtime error)

member.name: F:RGB.NET.Devices.Corsair.CorsairError.NotAllowed
member.summary: iCUE-SDK: if specific functionality (key interception) is disabled in iCUE settings (runtime error)

member.name: T:RGB.NET.Devices.Corsair.CorsairLedGroup

member.summary: iCUE-SDK: contains list of operations that can be applied to the property

member.summary: iCUE-SDK: describes readable property

member.summary: iCUE-SDK: describes writable property

member.name: F:RGB.NET.Devices.Corsair.CorsairPropertyFlag.Indexed

member.summary: iCUE-SDK: dummy value

member.name: F:RGB.NET.Devices.Corsair.CorsairSessionState.Closed
member.summary: iCUE-SDK: client not initialized or client closed connection (initial state)

member.summary: iCUE-SDK: client initiated connection but not connected yet

member.summary: iCUE-SDK: server did not respond, sdk will try again

member.summary: iCUE-SDK: server did not allow connection

member.summary: iCUE-SDK: server closed connection

member.name: F:RGB.NET.Devices.Corsair.CorsairSessionState.Connected
